resume.title: Freelance Developer
resume.summery:
I am a versatile web developer experienced in building user-friendly and feature-rich web applications. I have worked on various projects, including a fully-featured examination web app and a blood donation diary MVP. These applications enable seamless exam setup and efficient management of donation records for NGOs in the blood donation field.

In addition to project-specific work, I have played a key role in developing and maintaining online examination platforms. One notable project involved constructing an online examination platform from scratch, incorporating a Laravel RESTful API, a NextJS frontend, and a Vue.JS admin panel. I focused on designing a new user interface, implementing progress tracking charts, and enhancing user experience throughout the site. I also contributed to backend development, handling server management scripting, database operations, RESTful API development, socket implementation, Redis cache configuration, Laravel queue optimization, email handling, and Laravel job execution.

I have made significant contributions to mezohub.com, a platform dedicated to server management and application deployment. Here, I championed Test-Driven Development (TDD) to ensure codebase stability and spearheaded the migration of the front-end architecture from NextJS to Laravel, Inertia, and React. Collaborating closely with UI/UX designers, I transformed Figma designs into functional Tailwind CSS and React components, enhancing the user interface and experience.

projects.name: Project Name 1
projects.description: This application is fully featured web application for taking mcq exmaination. You can set up and get examination completely free of cost.

projects.name: Creating and maintaining an online examination platform
projects.description: Our team constructed this online examination platform from the ground up. This app is divided into three sections: the Laravel RESTful API, the NextJS frontend, and a Vue.JS admin panel. The site is mobile-friendly and SEO-friendly. My work included designing a new user interface for the entire site, including an examination, an analytics section, and a student dashboard. Create charts to allow students to track their progress. I started with React context and then moved on to Redux state management. I also added a blog section, comment and like buttons, and an admin section to manage the blog.
